intro: Ixora thwaitesii, commonly known as the Christmas rose, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Ixora thwaitesii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. It is widely cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
